  • Method Details

    • extractUsername

      public String extractUsername(String token)
      The extractUsername function extracts the username from a JWT token.
      Parameters:
      String - token Pass the token to the function
      Returns:
      The subject claim from the token

    • extractClaim

      public <T> T extractClaim(String token, Function<io.jsonwebtoken.Claims,T> claimsResolver)
      The extractClaim function is a generic function that takes in a token and returns the claims from it. The extractClaim function uses the extractAllClaims method to get all of the claims from our JWT, then applies them to our ClaimsResolver.
      Parameters:
      String - token Extract the claims from the token
      Function - <Claims Get the value of a claim from the token
      T - > claimsResolver Extract the claims from the token
      Returns:
      The claim value that is associated with the given key

    • extractResetClaim

      public <T> T extractResetClaim(String token, Function<io.jsonwebtoken.Claims,T> claimsResolver)
      The extractResetClaim function is a helper function that extracts the claims from a JWT token. The extractResetClaim function takes two arguments: 1) A String representing the JWT token to be parsed. 2) A Function object that accepts an instance of Claims and returns an object of type T, where T is generic.
      Parameters:
      String - token Extract the claims from the token
      Function - <Claims Return a value of type t
      T - > claimsResolver Extract the claims from the token
      Returns:
      A generic type

    • generateToken

      public String generateToken(Map<String,Object> extraClaims, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      The generateToken function is used to generate a JWT token for the user.
      Parameters:
      Map - <String Add extra claims to the jwt token
      Object - > extraClaims Add extra claims to the jwt
      UserDetails - userDetails Get the username of the user
      Returns:
      A string

    • generateToken

      public String generateToken(org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      The generateToken function is used to generate a JWT token for the user.
      Parameters:
      UserDetails - userDetails Get the username of the user
      Returns:
      A string that is the token

    • generateRefreshToken

      public String generateRefreshToken(org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      The generateRefreshToken function is used to generate a refresh token for the user. The function takes in a UserDetails object and returns a String that represents the refresh token. The function uses the buildToken method to create this string, passing in an empty HashMap, the UserDetails object, and an expiration time of 24 hours (86400 seconds).
      Parameters:
      UserDetails - userDetails Get the username of the user
      Returns:
      A token with the expiration time set to the refreshexpiration variable

    • generateFirstResetToken

      public String generateFirstResetToken(org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      The generateFirstResetToken function is used to generate a JWT token for the first time that a user requests password reset. This function will be called by the controller when it receives an HTTP POST request from /api/auth/reset-password. The function takes in one parameter, which is an instance of UserDetails, and returns a String containing the generated JWT token. The function uses buildFirstResetToken to create this token using jwtResetExpiration as its expiration date (which was set in AuthServiceImpl's constructor).
      Parameters:
      UserDetails - userDetails Get the username of the user
      Returns:
      A string, which is the token

    • generateResetToken

      public String generateResetToken(org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      The generateResetToken function is used to generate a reset token for the user.
      Parameters:
      UserDetails - userDetails Get the username of the user
      Returns:
      A jwt token

    • isTokenValid

      public boolean isTokenValid(String token, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      The isTokenValid function is used to check if a token has expired.
      Parameters:
      String - token Extract the username from the token
      UserDetails - userDetails Check if the token is valid for a particular user
      Returns:
      A boolean value

    • isTokenExpired

      public boolean isTokenExpired(String token)
      The isTokenExpired function checks to see if the token has expired.
      Parameters:
      String - token Extract the expiration date from the token
      Returns:
      A boolean value that indicates whether the token has expired
